intro: Stenandrium subcordatum, commonly known as the broadleaf stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
